alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 2:16PM PST until March 10 at 4:30PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Rain and Snowmelt in... West Central Tulare County in central California... * Until 430 PM PST. * At 216 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Farmersville, Exeter, Woodlake, Three Rivers, Lindcove and Lemon Cove. This includes the following streams and drainages... Grouse Creek, Kaweah River, Dry Creek, North Fork Tule River, Lane Slough, Jim Gray Creek, South Fork Kaweah River, Saint Johns River, Horse Creek, Ridenhour Creek and Greasy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
